name: Dr. Marcus Hale
statement: “Our museum’s ‘donation partnership’ program is legitimate. Reporters love to twist ‘loan agreements’ into something scandalous. I don’t know the tunnels, though—why would I? Dust on my cuffs? Stage storage is filthy this time of year.”

name: Lena Ortiz
statement: “Budget fiasco? Rumors. I spent the evening stabilizing messaging by the ops tent. I may have stepped away for a private call—music was deafening—but my team had eyes on the crowd.

name: Tao Nguyen
statement: “Keys are constantly checked out. I let Hale’s team handle a hatch earlier; it came back… I think after 21:30? People borrow, return, borrow again. If something went wrong, it’s because procedures were ignored—by someone else.”

name: Priya Nandakumar
statement: “Live the whole time? Mostly. A runner held my phone during a camera swap, and there was a cut when the connection dipped. If I’m off-screen thirty seconds, chat notices—believe me.”

name: Evan Brooks
statement: “Rope for a rig rehearsal, standard. If it smelled like grease, that’s from the winch in the rigging bay. Hale’s ‘consulting’ payments? Tiny stipends. This festival runs on side gigs.”
